question: What is Rocket.Chat?
answer: Rocket.Chat is an open-source team chat solution that enables you to communicate securely in real-time across devices.

question: How do I create a new channel?
answer: To create a new channel, click the '+' button next to the channels list and select 'Create New Channel'. Then enter the channel name and select whether it should be private or public.

question: How do I reset my password?
answer: To reset your password, click on the 'Forgot Password' link on the login page, enter your email address, and follow the instructions sent to your email.

question: Can I use Rocket.Chat on mobile devices?
answer: Yes, Rocket.Chat has mobile apps available for both iOS and Android devices. You can download them from the App Store or Google Play Store.

question: How do I mention someone in a chat?
answer: To mention someone in a chat, type '@' followed by their username. A dropdown menu will appear where you can select the correct user.

question: What are the system requirements for Rocket.Chat?
answer: Rocket.Chat can run on most systems with Node.js 12.x or higher, MongoDB 4.0 or higher, and at least 1GB of RAM. For production environments, 2GB RAM or more is recommended.

question: How do I install Rocket.Chat?
answer: You can install Rocket.Chat through various methods: 1) Using snap: 'snap install rocketchat-server', 2) Using Docker: 'docker run rocket.chat', 3) Manual installation from source, or 4) Using cloud hosting providers.

question: What is the difference between public and private channels?
answer: Public channels are visible to all users and can be joined freely. Private channels are invitation-only and are only visible to their members. Private channels have a lock icon next to their name.

question: How do I search for messages?
answer: Click the search icon in the top-right corner or use Ctrl/Cmd + K. You can search for messages, files, or users. Use filters like 'from:', 'in:', or 'before:' for advanced searches.

question: Can I integrate Rocket.Chat with other applications?
answer: Yes, Rocket.Chat supports numerous integrations through webhooks, REST API, and native integrations. Popular integrations include GitHub, Jira, Trello, Google Calendar, and many more.

question: how can I integrate Rocket.Chat with other applications?
answer: Download from respective app settings

question: How do I customize my profile?
answer: Click your avatar in the top-left corner, select 'My Account', then 'Profile'. Here you can change your name, username, email, avatar image, and status message.

question: What are Rocket.Chat's security features?
answer: Rocket.Chat includes end-to-end encryption, two-factor authentication (2FA), LDAP/Active Directory integration, OAuth support, and role-based access control (RBAC) for enterprise-grade security.

question: How do I share files in Rocket.Chat?
answer: You can share files by dragging and dropping them into the chat window, clicking the attachment icon (paper clip), or pasting them directly. Supported file types include images, documents, and videos.

question: What are LiveChat features in Rocket.Chat?
answer: LiveChat allows you to embed a chat widget on your website for customer support. It includes features like real-time visitor monitoring, chat routing, offline messaging, and integration with your existing channels.

question: How do I set up notifications?
answer: Go to Preferences > Notifications to customize your notification settings. You can set different notification preferences for desktop, mobile, and email, and configure them per room/channel.

question: Can I use Rocket.Chat offline?
answer: Yes, Rocket.Chat has offline support. Messages typed while offline will be sent when you reconnect. You can also access previously loaded messages and channels while offline.

question: How do I create a team?
answer: Click the 'Teams' option in the sidebar, then click 'Create New'. Enter your team name, choose privacy settings, and add members. Teams can contain multiple channels and discussions.

question: How do I delete a channel?
answer: Click the 'chats' option in the sidebar, then click 'delete'

question: What are Discussions in Rocket.Chat?
answer: Discussions are threaded conversations that can be started from any message. They help organize conversations around specific topics within a channel. Click the 'Start Discussion' option on any message to create one.

question: How do I use message formatting?
answer: Rocket.Chat supports Markdown formatting. Use *text* for bold, _text_ for italic, ~text~ for strikethrough, `text` for code, and ```text``` for code blocks. You can also use emojis by typing :emoji_name:.

question: What are slash commands?
answer: Slash commands are shortcuts starting with '/' that perform specific actions. Common commands include /msg to direct message, /invite to add users, /topic to set channel topic, and /help to see all available commands.

question: How do I backup my Rocket.Chat data?
answer: You can backup Rocket.Chat data by: 1) Using MongoDB's mongodump utility, 2) Taking filesystem snapshots, or 3) Using the built-in export tools in Administration > Import > Export Data.

question: How do I enable video calls in Rocket.Chat?
answer: Video calls can be enabled through Jitsi integration. Go to Administration > Video Conference and enable Jitsi. Users can then start video calls by clicking the video icon in any chat.

question: What is Omnichannel in Rocket.Chat?
answer: Omnichannel is Rocket.Chat's customer service solution that unifies various communication channels (LiveChat, Email, WhatsApp, etc.) into a single interface for customer support agents.

question: How do I set up email notifications?
answer: Go to Administration > Email > SMTP Settings. Configure your SMTP server details including host, port, username, and password. Then enable email notifications in your user preferences.

question: Can I customize the appearance of Rocket.Chat?
answer: Yes, administrators can customize the interface through Administration > Layout. You can change colors, logo, favicon, login page, and use custom CSS/JS for advanced customization.

question: How do I manage user roles and permissions?
answer: Go to Administration > Permissions to manage roles. You can create new roles, modify existing ones, and assign specific permissions to each role. Users can be assigned multiple roles.

question: What are Rocket.Chat's API capabilities?
answer: Rocket.Chat offers REST API, Real-time API, and GraphQL API. These can be used for custom integrations, chatbots, and extending functionality. API documentation is available at docs.rocket.chat.

question: How do I troubleshoot connection issues?
answer: Check your internet connection, clear browser cache, verify server status, ensure correct server URL, and check firewall settings. For persistent issues, check server logs or contact your administrator.

question: What are Rocket.Chat's file sharing limits?
answer: Default file size limits can be configured by administrators. Go to Administration > File Upload to set maximum file size, allowed file types, and storage location (local, Amazon S3, Google Cloud).

question: How do I create custom emojis?
answer: Administrators can add custom emojis through Administration > Custom Emoji. Upload an image file, set an alias, and optionally add tags. Users can then use these emojis like built-in ones.

question: What is Federation in Rocket.Chat?
answer: Federation allows different Rocket.Chat servers to communicate with each other. Users on one server can chat with users on another federated server, enabling cross-organization communication.

question: How do I set up LDAP authentication?
answer: Go to Administration > LDAP. Configure your LDAP server settings including host, port, bind credentials, and user search filters. Test the connection before enabling LDAP authentication.

question: Can I use Rocket.Chat with multiple languages?
answer: Yes, Rocket.Chat supports multiple languages. Users can select their preferred language in Preferences > User Interface > Language. Administrators can manage available languages in Administration > Settings.

question: How do I create and use message templates?
answer: Message templates can be created using the /template command or through Administration > Message Templates. Templates help standardize responses and save time for frequently used messages.

question: What are Rocket.Chat's backup best practices?
answer: Regular backups should include: 1) MongoDB database dumps, 2) Uploaded files, 3) Custom configurations, and 4) Integration settings. Store backups securely and test restoration procedures periodically.

question: How do I set up push notifications?
answer: Push notifications require configuring a push gateway. Use Rocket.Chat's push gateway or set up your own. Configure certificates for iOS and Firebase Cloud Messaging for Android in Administration > Push.

question: What are Rocket.Chat's scaling capabilities?
answer: Rocket.Chat can scale horizontally by adding more application servers and vertically by increasing server resources. Use load balancers, optimize MongoDB, and implement microservices architecture for large deployments.

question: How do I implement SSO (Single Sign-On)?
answer: Rocket.Chat supports various SSO providers including OAuth, SAML, and OpenID Connect. Configure your chosen provider in Administration > OAuth or SAML. Common providers include Google, GitHub, and custom SAML IdPs.

question: What are Rocket.Chat's compliance features?
answer: Compliance features include message auditing, data retention policies, user access logs, and export capabilities. Enable these in Administration > Compliance and configure retention rules as needed.

question: How do I optimize Rocket.Chat performance?
answer: Optimize performance by: 1) Using appropriate hardware, 2) Configuring MongoDB indexes, 3) Implementing caching, 4) Managing message history limits, and 5) Using CDN for media delivery.

question: Where can I download Rocket.Chat desktop apps?
answer: Download Rocket.Chat desktop apps from https://rocket.chat/download. Official apps are available for Windows (exe), macOS (dmg), and Linux (deb, rpm, snap). You can also download from the GitHub releases page.

question: How do I install Rocket.Chat on Windows?
answer: 1) Download the Windows installer (.exe) from rocket.chat/download, 2) Double-click the installer, 3) Follow the installation wizard, 4) Choose installation location and start menu preferences, 5) Launch the app and connect to your server.

question: How do I install Rocket.Chat on macOS?
answer: 1) Download the macOS disk image (.dmg) from rocket.chat/download, 2) Open the .dmg file, 3) Drag Rocket.Chat to your Applications folder, 4) Launch from Applications, 5) If needed, right-click and select Open to bypass Gatekeeper.

question: How do I install Rocket.Chat on Ubuntu?
answer: You can install Rocket.Chat on Ubuntu using snap: 1) Open terminal, 2) Run 'sudo snap install rocketchat-server', 3) Wait for installation to complete, 4) Access via http://localhost:3000. Alternatively, use 'apt install rocketchat' if using the official repository.

question: How do I install Rocket.Chat mobile app on iOS?
answer: 1) Open the App Store on your iOS device, 2) Search for 'Rocket.Chat', 3) Look for the official app by Rocket.Chat, 4) Tap 'Get' or the download icon, 5) Authenticate with Face ID/Touch ID if required, 6) Open the app and connect to your server.

question: How do I install Rocket.Chat mobile app on Android?
answer: 1) Open Google Play Store, 2) Search for 'Rocket.Chat', 3) Select the official app by Rocket.Chat, 4) Tap 'Install', 5) Accept the permissions, 6) Wait for download and installation, 7) Open and connect to your server.

question: How do I deploy Rocket.Chat using Docker?
answer: To deploy with Docker: 1) Install Docker, 2) Run 'docker pull rocket.chat', 3) Run 'docker run -p 3000:3000 rocket.chat'. For production, use docker-compose with MongoDB: create a docker-compose.yml file with both services and run 'docker-compose up -d'.

question: What are the minimum requirements for Rocket.Chat mobile apps?
answer: Mobile apps require: iOS 11.0 or later for Apple devices, Android 5.0 (Lollipop) or later for Android devices. Stable internet connection recommended. Some features may require newer OS versions.

question: How do I update Rocket.Chat desktop app?
answer: Desktop apps can auto-update: 1) Click 'Check for Updates' in app menu, 2) If available, click 'Download and Install'. Manual update: download latest version from rocket.chat/download and install over existing version. Settings are preserved.

question: Can I install multiple instances of Rocket.Chat?
answer: Yes, you can run multiple instances by: 1) Using different ports for each instance, 2) Using Docker containers with different names/ports, 3) Using separate virtual machines, or 4) Using different subdomains in production.

question: How do I install Rocket.Chat on AWS?
answer: Deploy on AWS: 1) Use AWS Marketplace for one-click deployment, 2) Launch EC2 instance with Rocket.Chat AMI, 3) Configure security groups for ports 3000/443, 4) Access via instance's public IP. Alternatively, use AWS ECS with Docker.

question: How do I install Rocket.Chat on DigitalOcean?
answer: Deploy on DigitalOcean: 1) Use Marketplace 1-Click App, 2) Choose droplet size (minimum 2GB RAM), 3) Select datacenter region, 4) Add SSH keys, 5) Create droplet, 6) Access via droplet's IP address once installation completes.

question: What are common installation errors and solutions?
answer: Common issues: 1) Port 3000 already in use - change port, 2) MongoDB connection fails - check MongoDB service, 3) Insufficient memory - increase RAM/swap, 4) Permission errors - run with sudo/correct permissions, 5) Network issues - check firewall settings.

question: How do I verify my Rocket.Chat installation?
answer: Verify installation: 1) Check server is running (http://localhost:3000), 2) Create admin account, 3) Test basic features (messaging, file upload), 4) Check logs for errors, 5) Monitor system resources, 6) Test external access if needed.
